title: Oxton Walks

images.title: Main Street, Oxton, Notts. by David Hallam-Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Main Street, Oxton, Notts.

images.title: Oxton Ford by John Walton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Oxton Ford.  Oxton has two fords – a small ford within the village itself, and a much larger ford on Beanford Lane – often as deep as 1-foot (0.30 m) whilst remaining open to all traffic. It is however closed each March, so that the toads found in the swamp-like area, which the ford crosses, can breed.

images.title: Oxton Bogs, Oxton, Notts. by David Hallam-Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: This is the access point (or exit from) the wooded area in which this series of lakes and bogs are situated as seen from the Gorse Covert (i.e. Oxton) side of them. The farm track seen here is used to delineate the civil parish boundary between Calverton and Oxton.

images.title: Jim Thornton / Pond on Calverton slag heap
images.caption: Pond on Calverton slag heap. This pond is on the northern slopes of the reclaimed slag heap of Calverton coal mine

images.title: Tom Courtney / The Ford
images.caption: The Ford. on Beanford Lane known locally as the Oxton water splash.

images.title: Jim Thornton / Disused railway line Calverton
images.caption: Disused railway line Calverton

images.title: johnfromnotts / Ye Olde Bridge Inn at Oxton
images.caption: Ye Olde Bridge Inn at Oxton

description: This Nottinghamshire village is based near Southwell and Lowdham . This walk from the village takes you west to visit the Oxton Bogs and the old Calverton coal mine to the west of the settlement. There's some nice footpaths in this area with lakes, a ford, an old railway line and views over the surrounding countryside to enjoy on the way. To continue your walking in the area head north west to visit Blidworth Woods . Here you can enjoy some peaceful woodland trails and pick up the long distance Robin Hood Way to explore the surrounding Sherwood Forest area. Burntstump Country Park lies just to the west and is another local walking highlight.
